questions.question: How do you create a PySpark DataFrame from a list of tuples and display its content?
questions.expected_answer:
data = [
    ("Tony", 50, 400000),
    ("Brandy", 48, 400000),
    ("Sarah", 46, 300000)
]

columns = ("Name", "Age", "Salary")
df = spark.createDataFrame(data, columns)
df.show()

questions.question: How do you create a SparkSession in PySpark?
questions.expected_answer:
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

spark = SparkSession.builder\
    .appName("Test")\
    .getOrCreate()

print("Spark session created.")
